poem:
Brat

In these pages of today,  
a word rises,  
like a green tendril from soil:  
brat.  
Not merely the child,  
but an emblem of chaos,  
a celebration  
of a mess we dare to embrace.  
Charli sings it,  
and we wear it,  
a badge fashioned in slime,  
as lexicographers  
inscribe it  
into the annals of now.
